Stretching exercises, splits training at home. Flexibility training.
Stretching may not be the most exciting part of working out, but doing flexibility work is just as important for a well-rounded fitness routine as strength and cardio work. Incorporating some stretching exercises into your workout schedule will help you improve flexibility, reduce tightness, and ultimately, make your workouts more efficient and safe.
Tight muscles can cause undue strain on the neighboring joints during normal daily function, or they themselves can become injured," Sasha Cyrelson, D.P.T., clinical director at Professional Physical Therapy in Sicklerville, New Jersey, tells SELF. As we age, our muscles get shorter and less elastic, she adds. "We need to take an active role in maintaining and improving the length of our muscles so we can continue to enjoy our abilities without pain.
Standing Hamstring Stretch.
Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, arms by your sides.Exhale as you bend forward at the hips, lowering your head toward floor, while keeping your head, neck and shoulders relaxed.Wrap your arms around backs of your legs and hold anywhere from 45 seconds to two minutes.Bend your knees and roll up when you're done.
Piriformis Stretch

The piriformis muscle is a deep internal hip rotator, located on the outside of the butt. Its primary role is external rotation, Atkins says. "Deep internal rotators, while small, produce a lot of the movement at the hip and are often overlooked.Since the piriformis crosses over the sciatic nerve, "if it is tight, it can result in sciatic nerve irritation, Cyrelson says. Stretching this muscle can prevent potential future sciatica, or help treat it.
Lunge With Spinal Twist

Atkins notes that this stretch is commonly referred to as the World's Greatest Stretch (WGS) in the fitness community. And for good reason: "It's essential to help with posture-related pain or for people who sit for prolonged periods of time," says Dan Giordano, D.P.T., C.S.C.S., cofounder of Bespoke Treatments Physical Therapy in New York City and Seattle. "It helps open your hips and improve thoracic (mid-back) mobility," he tells SELF.
Figure Four Stretch

"This specifically stretches the piriformis and iliopsoas muscles (essentially your hip rotator and flexor muscles) and the IT band. Because of this and the passive nature of the pose, it is an excellent and gentle approach to helping relieve symptoms associated with sciatica and knee pain," John Murray, yoga instructor and co-founder of Lyons Den Power Yoga, tells SELF.
90/90 Stretch

This modification of pigeon pose helps with internal rotation of one leg and external rotation of the other, "so you're hitting both movements of the hip at once," Atkins says. It's a good option for people who have extremely tight hip flexors, she adds. "The front thigh is safely on the ground in a position that doesn't cause too much stress."
Frog Stretch

RECORD, ANALYZE, IMPROVE


Ochy offers runners, coaches, physiotherapist the possibility to evaluate running technique from anywhere using video and AI in order to prevent injuries or improve performance. This is an analysis of the gait and full body. The app identifies the runner’s weak points and provides details and what they should do to improve. The app provides the following analysis and running metrics:
-	Foot strike – understand how the foot lands on the ground (heel, midfoot, forefoot) in relations to your center of mass
-	Head position – Are you looking down when your run or straight ahead
-	Back position – Do you have a good enough forward lean
-	Arm position – Are your arms relaxed
-	Heel kick – Are you driving your legs up far enough
-	Front leg flexion – is your leg too bent causing you to lose energy
-	Ground contact time – how much time are you spending on the ground
-	Time between steps – How much time you take between the steps
-	Vertical oscillation – Are you doing too much bouncing
-	Leg cycle – Do you have a good leg flow


HOW IT WORKS

-	Record or upload a video (7 seconds maximum) of yourself running
-	Receive a detailed analysis of your running technique within 60 seconds

The core AI technology computer vision to capture the movement of a person regardless of where they are running (on the road, forest, track, treadmill etc). This is then plugged into a biomechanics algorithm that considers every part of the body plus the person’s height, weight, gender, and running speed so we provide a diagnosis-specific for them. With that, the algorithm points out which area of the body the movement is not optimal for the running activity they are doing. Base on the analysis, we identify the weak points of the person and use an improved algorithm to provide a specific muscle groups to work on to improve the weak points so the person can run more efficiently in order to prevent injuries or improve performance.
Who is the product for?
•	Coaches: Help a coach to understand their athlete and create a good training program
•	Runners: Help runners who don’t have a coach to evaluate their technique and have a plan to improve
•	Medical Professionals: Help medical professionals (kine, Osteo) to evaluate the technique of their patients and provide the good rehab

The aim is to make the sports, that swim under the radar, visible via a digital platform. All those interested are given the opportunity to follow their favourite club. It doesn’t matter whether this happens via the smartphone, laptop or TV screen. The heart of the system is the 180-degree HD camera system that works entirely without a cameraman. The special development of the weatherproof technology, which is installed by sporttotal once fixed, is its software. The algorithm follows the game automatically. Without a chip in ball or jersey. 

AMATEUR SPORT IN GERMANY
Germany is crazy about sports. Over 24 million amateur athletes, organised in 90,000 clubs. Since 2017 sporttotal broadcasts sport events live, which you can also enjoy on demand.

Sports TV Live has live coverage from worldwide sport leagues, cups and tournaments with live updated results, statistics, league tables, sport highlights and fixtures.
Sport Live matches have fast and accurate updates for minutes, scores, halftime and full time soccer results, goal scorers and assistants, cards, substitutions and match statistics.

App has details for each team where you can see matches, tables, fixtures, results, statistics and much more.
With latest sport events, you can get all important matches, results and statistics.

HomeCourt is the free, interactive basketball app that helps anyone get better. It’s the personal basketball trainer that’s always with you, capturing your performance, your stats, and your progress—guiding you to the next level. With HomeCourt, every rep counts. 

TRAIN SMARTER
HomeCourt captures your moves and your stats as you train—so you can see your true skill level. HomeCourt uses the camera on your device to track your performance in real-time, everything from your jump shot to your crossover. In-depth data and analytics help you break down every session. HomeCourt calculates metrics like shooting percentage, accuracy, release time, dribble speed, vertical jump and more. You can even use Apple Watch to track your heart rate and save your data to HealthKit. 

ENGAGE IN FUN, INTERACTIVE DRILLS
Using HomeCourt is less like training and more like a video game. The immersive live-action experience is powered by AR (augmented reality), with virtual targets, audio cues, bonus levels, points and badges—it’s like you’re inside the game. Now practicing skills is engaging, not boring, so you’ll stick to it and improve more. 

LEARN FROM THE PROS
HomeCourt is an official partner of the NBA and provides access to the expertise of the most elite players in the game today. Train with interactive drills and instruction from NBA and WNBA athletes. Learn their moves and even compete against them in interactive challenges. 

COMPETE WITH FRIENDS
Don’t workout alone, compete virtually with your friends, family, and teammates. You can join a virtual Team on HomeCourt, or create your own Team for free. You can also challenge a friend or teammate to any HomeCourt activity with a time-shifted “Battle Mode” that matches you up head-to-head. As you compete in Battles, you collect trophies, badges, and coins, just like you would in a video game. Earn rewards and level up together.

SHOWCASE YOUR SKILLS
Engage in unique showcase activities and even get discovered directly by the NBA.
